data.question: Which of the following sites is famous for stupas, monasteries, temples and pillars ?
The Archaeological Survey of India(ASI) in it's current form established in :

The eulogies or “prashasti” among the following inscriptions :
data.op1: I, II and III are correct.
data.op2: I and II are only correct.
data.op3: II and III are only correct.
data.op4: I, III and IV are correct.

data.question: Ashoka carved out rock-cut caves at Barabar and Nagarjun hills in Bihar for one of the following :

The religion of early Vedic Aryans was primarily of
The ancient Indian play Mudrarakshasa of Visakhadutt has its subject on:
data.op1: The court intrigues at the time of Chandragupta
data.op2: The story of the power struggle between two Aryan.
data.op3: A romantic story of an Aryan prince and a tribal woman
data.op4: A conflict between Gods and emons of ancient Hindu lore

data.question: In the Mahayana Buddhism, the Bodhisatya Avalokitesvara was also known as:
Many of the Greeks, Kushanas and Shakas embraced Buddhism rather than Hinduism because:
data.op1: Buddhism was in the ascendant at that time
data.op2: uddhism provided easier access to Indian society
data.op3: They had renounced the policy of war and violence
data.op4: Caste-ridden Hinduism did not attract them
